    • Constructor Detail

      • TEHashChain

        public TEHashChain()
        Constructs a new TEHashChain instance. The chain is formed by including the hash from the previous entry into the hash calculation for the current entry. Thus the action of adding a new element involves the effort of hashing the current entry, but verification involves recalculating the hashes of the chain items from the beginning.

    • Method Detail

        public SHA256Hash getSHA256Hash()

        the SHA-256 hash of the last tamper-evident item on the hash chain, or null if the chain is empty

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Validates the tamper-evident hash chain beginning at the indexed item, assuming the prior chain items are valid.
        Returns:
        whether the hash chain is either empty, or that its items are a valid hash chain

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid​(int index)
        Validates the tamper-evident hash chain beginning at the indexed item, assuming the prior chain items are valid.
        Parameters:
        index - the index from which to begin validating the chain, with value 0 indicating the whole chain
        Returns:
        whether the specified portion of the hash chain is valid
